page.title: 11BISHOPTHORPE VILLAGE
page.content: Bishopthorpe is a small village to the south of York. It has developed around Archbishop's Palace. Main Street is the oldest area of housing and a lot of the houses there are Victorian or earlier. In the last twenty years there has been a lot of house building, and most of the people travel in to York to work. The village has its own modern library, and the Infant and Junior schools have both been built in the last twenty years. The old school is used as a Youth Club, and for the Toddler Group. The village also has its own shops, where most things can be bought, a petrol filling station, and several pubs on Main Street. It also has a Methodist Church as well as St. Andrew's.
